to take part in the sport of wakeboarding
the sport of riding on a short, wide board called a wakeboard while being pulled along through the water by a fast boat wake
a game played by two teams of people swimming in a swimming pool. Players try to throw a ball into the other team’s goal.
to ski on water while being pulled by a fast boat
either of the pair of long, flat boards on which a person stands in order to waterski
the sport or activity of skiing on water while being pulled by a fast boat

examples.x: We snorkelled and did some waterskiing.

senses.definition: sports that are done on or in water, for example sailing and waterskiing
a machine that makes waves in the water in a swimming pool

examples.x: The pool has a wave machine.

senses.definition: a belt or jacket which helps you to stay underwater, for example when diving or doing exercises
a piece of clothing made of rubber that fits the whole body closely, worn, for example, by people swimming underwater or sailing in order to keep warm
a place in a river or the sea where currents of water turn round and round very fast

examples.x: She felt she was being dragged into a whirlpool of emotion.

senses.definition: a special bath or swimming pool for relaxing in, in which the water moves in circles
a part of a river that looks white because the water is moving very fast over rocks

examples.x: a stretch of white water
white-water rafting

senses.definition: a part of the sea or ocean that looks white because it is very rough and the waves are high
the measurement from one side of something to the other; how wide something is

examples.x: The terrace runs the full width of the house.
It's about ten metres in width.
The carpet is available in different widths.

senses.definition: a piece of material of a particular width

examples.x: You'll need two widths of fabric for each curtain.

senses.definition: the distance between the two long sides of a swimming pool

examples.x: How many widths can you swim?

senses.definition: to sail across water standing on a windsurfer

examples.x: Most visitors come to sail or windsurf.

senses.definition: a long, narrow board with a sail, that you stand on and sail across water on
a person on a windsurfer
the sport of sailing on water standing on a windsurfer

examples.x: to go windsurfing

senses.definition: to fall over, especially when you are doing a sport such as skiing or surfing

examples.x: She wiped out at the third gate in the slalom race.

senses.definition: a sailing boat, often also with an engine and a place to sleep on board, used for pleasure trips and racing

examples.x: a 12-metre racing yacht
a yacht club/race

senses.definition: a large boat with an engine and a place to sleep on board, used for pleasure trips

examples.x: a luxury yacht
a motor yacht

senses.definition: the sport or activity of sailing or racing yachts

examples.x: They go yachting at weekends.
a yachting holiday

senses.definition: a type of boat with sails
a rowing boat carried on a ship
